content.raw: Yup, all ign-gui Linux builds are broken now :grimacing:
content.html: Yup, all ign-gui Linux builds are broken now

content.raw: Thanks! Now ign-rendering depends on a branch of ign-cmake, right? Was that on purpose? I think Ign-GUI's CI will be broken now :confused:
content.html: Thanks! Now ign-rendering depends on a branch of ign-cmake, right? Was that on purpose? I think Ign-GUI's CI will be broken now

update.description:
The large diff is the result of rearranging the components, `ogre` and `optix`, from ign-rendering/src to the root directory. 

The code is mainly the same except updates to 

* header guard

* visibility macro, e.g.  now using `IGNITION_RENDERING_XXX_VISIBLE`

* CMakeLists.txt

This PR uses the following ign branches:

* ign-cmake: `Components`

* ign-common: ~~Components~~ `ign-common1`

* ign-math: `ign-math4`

Note: ign-cmake's `Components` branch is upgraded to ign-cmake1 which conflicts with any existing deb installation of ign-cmake0 (as [described here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/51/guard-against-accidentally-switching-to/diff)). However, ign-math4 still depends on ign-cmake0. So you'll need to install ign-cmake0 from source using the `ign-cmake0` branch in ign-cmake
update.title: Ign-cmake integration

content.raw:
I’m leaving my 2 cents more as a tester than as a reviewer:

I tested building it from scratch inside a clean docker environment, by making use of the indicated branches for the other ignition libraries and it worked as expected. With this I mean I was able to run the tests as well as the examples included in the repo with no issues (haven’t tried the OptiX part though).

I can also confirm that consuming the ignition-math4 libraries installed by [drake](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake) instead of the ones installed from debs or from sources also works without issues.
content.html:
I’m leaving my 2 cents more as a tester than as a reviewer:

I tested building it from scratch inside a clean docker environment, by making use of the indicated branches for the other ignition libraries and it worked as expected. With this I mean I was able to run the tests as well as the examples included in the repo with no issues (haven’t tried the OptiX part though).

I can also confirm that consuming the ignition-math4 libraries installed by drake instead of the ones installed from debs or from sources also works without issues.

I got an error running `INTEGRATION_shadows` on Ubuntu Zesty:

```
#!c++


[ RUN      ] Shadows/ShadowsTest.Shadows/0
[Err] [OgreRTShaderSystem.cc:432] Unable to find shader lib. Shader generating will fail.
[Err] [OgreRTShaderSystem.cc:114] Cannot find OGRE rtshaderlib. Shadows will be disabled.
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-rendering/test/integration/shadows.cc:143: Failure
Expected: (shaded) < (unshaded), actual: 6400 vs 6400
...
[  FAILED  ] Shadows/ShadowsTest.Shadows/0, where GetParam() = "ogre" (32 ms)
```
